title: Our Youtubers, Riot Members, and Community.
body:
Riot, this is mainly for you guys.
Everyone else is welcome too.

I think Riot should thank the League Youtubers for what they do.
They make vids of there game, promoting it and everything.

They make people laugh, Get better, improve on themselves.
Riot themselves sometimes go out of there way to help the community as best as they can.

Steamers make a good living off of this aswell.

I think Riot should grant Streamers, and Youtubers there Own Summoners Icons and Banners.
You know as a reward for the things they have done.

Riot already have there own Icons, why not extend the courtesy to the community.
Heck Ive spend like a few hundred on Skins and Gifting, never been reported.

Maybe next time riot should make a reward a summoners own costume icon.
(I pay for skins, I may as well pay for my own icon- even though I have no idea what Ill make it.)

Yes I do understand that some people may have there icons........ Not rated for some players.
We can brain storm a way to fix that.

Anybody else got some ideas for things like this?

I have suggested a long time ago, that we should be able to "Pool" RP.
I occasionally have like 100 RP that I cannot use, may as well pool it for something.

-Like we, as a community could pool RP. Then riot could do something with that RP-
Maybe distribute it to summoners that have done some nice things?
Bring modes back?

That's it for now, but I'm going to list SOME league Youtubers.

replies.body:
I have thought about this a lot, and I completely agree that it would be fantastic if there were a reward system in place for people that contribute heavily to the community.  My personal thought here is that a volunteer program (think Emissaries of the League, Wrenchmen, etc.) would be a really effective way to achieve this, but it definitely shouldn't be limited to YouTubers.

The volunteer group’s purpose would be to find and reward players that consistently add value to the community and the experience of other players.  This can take many forms from content production (YouTube, particularly insightful forum discussion, etc.) to tournament organizers, even third party site owners.  Players that are part of this group would be publicly recognized for their contributions, and encouraged to help others develop their own community initiatives.  Here are the goals for this program:

1)	Reward players for outstanding community contribution – Recognition and possible resources provided by Riot 
2)	Encourage players to contribute to the community in their own unique ways
3)	Maintain an ecosystem whereby members of this group can use their own experiences and resources to assist other players in their endeavors.

It's a complicated discussion, for sure, but I feel like there's a lot of value in a long-term program for players of this level of dedication.

Yeah I agree.
And a watchman system is a new and exiting idea.

Those YouTubers get paid enough, they don't need Riot's thanks. Also DiscoHeat is an abomination to the League community. I hate him so fucking much, I'd wish death on him and his family, but that's to good for him.
